title: Korumburra, South Gippsland, Victoria

abstract: From Kurumburra in 1921, a beautiful record of the iconic Australian country show.
description: Produced by Pathe Home Cinema on behalf of the Progressive Gippsland Publicity Campaign, this promotional film sets its lens on the 1921 Korumburra Show. Following a panorama of the grounds and a very dignified parade, all of the usual suspects are featured: we are treated to a judges-eye view of a very impressive line-up of Ayrshire cattle as they are paraded for the camera, followed by the misleadingly titled segment – Incidents at the Trotting Race – which seems to have actually been entirely incident-free (undoubtedly to the relief of both riders and mounts)! Next up are a prize litter of Yorkshire pigs, an interlude of horse jumping, before more prize winners – this time it’s sheep and the cattle featured in solo shots. All this excitement is followed by a visit to the Korumburra Co-Operative Butter Factory - all in all, an exhilarating day out in Korumburra!
